intro: Morisonia tarapotensis, commonly known as the Tarapoto morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of northern Peru. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along stream banks or in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
